field.name: summary
field.value: Could not save <model>. Ambiguous match found. (AmbiguousMatchException when using Scaffolding and ActiveRecordValidationBase<T>)

field.name: description
field.value:
When using scaffolding on a controller with a model that inherits from ActiveRecordValidationBase<T>, a System.Reflection.AmbiguousMatchException was thrown. On the webpage you get an message "Could not save <AR model class>. Ambiguous match found."
Cause: in MonoRail/Castle.MonoRail.ActiveRecordSupport/Scaffold/Utils/CommonOperationUtils.cs SaveInstance(...) type.GetMethod("IsValid") is called, but there are two ambiguous IsValid methods. Now it is patched to use type.GetMethod("IsValid", System.Type.EmptyTypes).
I think it also applies to these posts: http://forum.castleproject.org/viewtopic.php?t=3760&start=0&postdays=0&postorder=asc&highlight= http://groups.google.com/group/castle-project-users/browse_thread/thread/d34e0d2349f613c4/1595381e5bcb6443?hl=en&lnk=gst&q=ActiveRecordValidationBase%3C#1595381e5bcb6443
This is my first patch so i hope i did it right... Compliments to the castle team for building such a great framework!
